Italian Cuisine.name: Margherita Pizza
Italian Cuisine.description: A Neapolitan pizza with fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, basil, olive oil, and salt.

Italian Cuisine.name: Four Cheese Pizza
Italian Cuisine.description: Pizza topped with mozzarella, Parmesan, gorgonzola, and ricotta or fontina.

Italian Cuisine.name: Neapolitan Pizza
Italian Cuisine.description: Thin-crust pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil, baked in a wood-fired oven.

Italian Cuisine.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
Italian Cuisine.description: Roman pasta with eggs, Pecorino Romano, pancetta, and black pepper.

Italian Cuisine.name: Fettuccine Alfredo
Italian Cuisine.description: Fettuccine noodles tossed in butter and Parmesan.

Italian Cuisine.name: Lasagna
Italian Cuisine.description: Layers of pasta with meat (or vegetable) sauce, cheese, and béchamel.

Italian Cuisine.name: Panini
Italian Cuisine.description: Sandwich made from various Italian breads (ciabatta, baguette) with deli meats, cheese, and sometimes grilled.

American Cuisine.name: Classic Hot Dog
American Cuisine.description: Grilled or steamed sausage in a bun, topped with mustard, ketchup, onions, relish, or sauerkraut.

American Cuisine.name: Pepperoni Pizza
American Cuisine.description: Tomato sauce, mozzarella, and pepperoni slices.

American Cuisine.name: Macaroni and Cheese
American Cuisine.description: Creamy pasta dish with elbow macaroni baked in cheese sauce.

American Cuisine.name: BLT Sandwich
American Cuisine.description: Bacon, lettuce, and tomato on toasted bread.

American Cuisine.name: Reuben Sandwich
American Cuisine.description: Corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, and Russian dressing on rye.

American Cuisine.name: Sloppy Joe
American Cuisine.description: Ground beef in seasoned tomato sauce on a round bun.

American Cuisine.name: Po' boy
American Cuisine.description: Crusty bread filled with fried seafood or roast beef, traditional in Louisiana.

British Cuisine.name: Bacon Sandwich
British Cuisine.description: Typically served with ketchup or brown sauce.

British Cuisine.name: Chip Butty
British Cuisine.description: Bread filled with chips, often with vinegar or ketchup.

British Cuisine.name: Cucumber Sandwich
British Cuisine.description: Thinly sliced cucumber on crustless, buttered bread.

British Cuisine.name: Jam Sandwich
British Cuisine.description: Buttered bread with jam, typically strawberry, for a quick snack.

Mexican Cuisine.name: Cemita
Mexican Cuisine.description: A sandwich with sliced avocado, white cheese, onions, and red sauce on a sesame-seeded egg roll.

Mexican Cuisine.name: Torta Ahogada
Mexican Cuisine.description: A Guadalajara specialty with pork-stuffed bread, submerged in a spicy chile sauce.

Mexican Cuisine.name: Guajolota
Mexican Cuisine.description: Bolillo bread stuffed with tamales, popular street food in Mexico City.

French Cuisine.name: Croque-Monsieur
French Cuisine.description: Grilled ham and cheese with béchamel sauce.

French Cuisine.name: Jambon-Beurre
French Cuisine.description: A baguette with butter and ham, a classic Parisian sandwich.

French Cuisine.name: Pan-bagnat
French Cuisine.description: A Nice specialty with tuna, olives, hard-boiled eggs, and vegetables on round bread, served chilled.

Japanese Cuisine.name: Katsu Sando
Japanese Cuisine.description: Breaded and fried pork cutlet in a soft sandwich.

Japanese Cuisine.name: Yakisoba-pan
Japanese Cuisine.description: Hot dog bun filled with fried noodles, often topped with pickles and mayonnaise.

German Cuisine.name: Currywurst
German Cuisine.description: Bratwurst with curry-flavored ketchup, often served with fries.

German Cuisine.name: Butterbrot
German Cuisine.description: Open-faced bread with butter, topped with sweet or savory ingredients.

German Cuisine.name: Mettbrötchen
German Cuisine.description: Raw minced pork on bread with raw onions, popular as a breakfast or snack item.

Greek Cuisine.name: Gyro
Greek Cuisine.description: Meat roasted on a vertical spit, with tomato, onion, and yogurt sauce in pita bread.

Greek Cuisine.name: Souvlaki
Greek Cuisine.description: Skewered grilled meat served on pita with lettuce, tomato, and tzatziki sauce.

Middle Eastern Cuisine.name: Falafel
Middle Eastern Cuisine.description: Deep-fried chickpea balls with vegetables and tahini in pita.

Middle Eastern Cuisine.name: Shawarma
Middle Eastern Cuisine.description: Flatbread filled with meat, usually beef or chicken, with cucumber, tomato, and tahini.

Argentinian Cuisine.name: Choripán
Argentinian Cuisine.description: Grilled chorizo on a crusty roll with chimichurri sauce.

Argentinian Cuisine.name: Pebete
Argentinian Cuisine.description: A soft, oval bun with cheese, cured meat, tomato, and mayonnaise.
